page.title: 08HOUSING--NEW ESTATES
page.content: The{population}of Wadebridge is{4009.} The{total number of houses is 1890},{ {1521}of these are{private}houses and{ {369}are{council houses.}Some houses in the town are only occupied during the holiday season. The older houses are mostly in the centre of the town. THe older houses are built of local stone with slate roofs. Newer houses are built of concrete blocks and tiles. For several years no new houses have been built because of a building embargo imposed by the South West Water Authority but with the completion of the sewage works in 1985 the embargo has been lifted. Three new private estates are being built at{ {Whiterock Orchard, Guineaport,and {Polmear Court}. The North Cornwall District Council has just completed a housing scheme at{Southern Way.}
